intro: Epilobium oregonense, commonly known as Oregon fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
